item.title: 欧洲央行马赫卢夫提醒切勿仓促决策
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员加布里埃尔-马克鲁夫（Gabriel Makhlouf）表示，欧洲中央银行应能在 6 月份就利率问题做出决定。【原文：The European Central Bank should be able to make a decision on interest rates in June, according to Governing Council member Gabriel Makhlouf.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚央行行长称数据为更大幅度降息铺平道路
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行董事会的一位成员表示，哥伦比亚不断放缓的通胀和疲软的经济需要更积极的降息，但决策者必须对未来的潜在风险保持警惕。【原文：Colombia’s slowing inflation and weak economy call for more aggressive interest rate cuts, though policymakers must remain vigilant to potential risks ahead, according to a member of the central bank’s board.】

item.title: 苹果公司与投资者就欺诈案达成 4.9 亿美元和解协议
item.description: 苹果公司与一群投资者达成了一项 4.9 亿美元的和解协议，这些投资者指控首席执行官蒂姆-库克在 2018 年就公司的销售前景发表了虚假和误导性的声明。【原文：Apple Inc. has reached a $490 million settlement with a group of investors who had accused Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook of making false and misleading statements in 2018 about the company’s sales prospects.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势持续，马克龙将在巴黎接待中国国家主席习近平
item.description: 在欧盟与世界第二大经济体之间的贸易紧张局势挥之不去之际，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙计划于春季在巴黎接待中国总统习近平。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron plans to host Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping in Paris in the spring amid lingering trade tensions between the European Union and the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.description: 智利有许多公寓空置，政府正考虑介入购买一些公寓。在一个住房短缺才是典型问题的世界里，这是一个不寻常的举动。【原文：There are so many apartments sitting empty in Chile that the government is considering stepping in to buy some. That’s an unusual move in a world where it’s a shortage of housing that is typically the problem.】
